incidents.name: Missing usage alerts for subuser accounts

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue with usage alerts related to subuser accounts. Starting October 2, 11:42 AM PST and until October 13, 12:50 PM PST, administrators of parent accounts might not have been able to set up credit usage alerts for subusers.  This didn't impact email sending. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Email Activity Feed Search Criteria Issues

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue searching the Email Activity Feed has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Email Activity Feed searches that include account names are working again. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 2 pm PDT on 10/7/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with the Email Activity Feed. Users may see “No search results” when searches include an account name. 

This filter is included by default, which may prevent expected search results from appearing until the account name is manually removed. As a workaround, removing the account name from the search will display results, but we understand this impacts customers who rely on filtering by parent or subuser usernames. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve this and restore full search functionality.

This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

components.name: Email Activity
components.description: Email Activity Feed event data and functionality

incidents.name: Email processing delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue with email processing delays. From 9:30 AM PST to 10:03 AM PST, some customers may have noticed their emails stuck in Processing status for up to 30 minutes in their Email Activity feed. This didn't impact the email sending itself. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: v3 Email Activity Feed API Errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the v3 Email Activity Feed API Errors has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer see intermittent 503 errors when calling the v3 Email Activity Feed API endpoints. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:50 PDT on 9/30/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with the v3 Email Activity Feed API. Users may see intermittent 503 errors when making GET calls to the /v3/messages & /v3/messages/{msgid} API endpoints.

This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Increased error rates in Email Activity Feed API endpoint

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with GET calls to the endpoint /v3/messages/{msgid}. From 7:24 AM PST until 7:47 AM PST, customers may have experienced up to 50% error rates when using this API endpoint, or when using the Email Activity Feed in the SendGrid UI. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Paid plan users that should have access to live chat support should now have the ability to speak with customer support through the live chat service. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate the issue. Another update will be provided in two hours or as soon as new information is available to share.

We will provide an update in one hour or sooner as more information becomes available

incidents.name: Retroactive Incident - Email delivery delays

Between 'July 28th 3:00 AM PST, 2025' and 'July 28th 8:30 AM PST, 2025', there was an issue where email deliveries were delayed where some mails that should have been delivered immediately, were finally delivered a few hours ago. A delay of approximately 5 hours could have been seen.

Starting around 09:58 AM PT, July 14th, our engineers began investigating an issue where some users were unable to create chat conversations over the Help Support Center. Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. 

This doesn't affect Mail Send.

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Degraded SMTP sending Performance

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with SMTP degraded performance has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 8:18 AM (PST) on 07/14, our engineers began investigating an issue with Email SMTP Service. Some customers may experience issue when sending emails seeing the following error message: "too many recipients". This issue only impacts SMTP mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Single Send stats experiencing no stats displayed on emails sent.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Single Sends stats has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers are continuing to monitor the issue and restore stats on Single Sends that are not displaying data. Any new Single Sends sent after 3:00pm PST will show correct stats. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers continue to monitor the issue with Single Send Stats. Any new Single Sends sent after 3:00pm PST will show stats. We are continuing to restore stats on Single Sends that are not displaying data  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Any new Single Sends sent after 3:00pm PST will show stats. Engineering is restoring stats on Single Sends that are not displaying data  We will provide another update in 30 min or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate the issue impacting SendGrid Marketing Single Sends stats. Single Send emails are sending as expected. We are working to restore stats and will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are continuing to identify the issue affecting SendGrid Marketing Single Sends stats and are working towards a solution. Single Send emails are sending as expected. We are working to restore stats and will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10am PT on today, our engineers began investigating an issue with SendGrid Marketing Single Sends. Users may experience an issue with stats reporting a hyphen “-“ on a particular Single Send's stats. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Event Webhook and Geographic Statistics has been resolved.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:30pm PST on July 11th, our engineers began investigating an issue with Event Webhook and Geographic Statistics that had been identified on June 3rd. Customers may experience incorrect IP address and SG machine open data. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Retroactive - Degraded Activity Feed API Performance

incident_updates.body: Starting around 2:00pm PST, July 2nd, our engineers identified degraded performance with the Activity Feed API, caused by certain user-related filters (api_key_id, user_agent, credential_id, teammate username) returning incomplete data. This did not impact Mail Send. Issue was remediated on July 9th, a fix has been implemented, no new issues have been reported from our end, and no new reports from customers have been reported. This issue is now resolved.

incidents.name: Retroincident - Temporary Click Tracking degraded performance

incident_updates.body:
Starting around 10.05 PT, June 30th, our engineers discovered an issue with Click Tracking where intermittent errors around our links were occurring. Links were not resolving correctly, however, customers just need to retry to make the links work. 

No data loss has been discovered as long as the link worked.

Mail send was not affected.

Issue has been quickly remediated, a fix has been implemented, no new issues have been reported from our end, and no new reports from customer have been reported. This issue is now resolved.

Our engineers have applied a fix to the issue and now are monitoring the results. We will provide an update in one hour or as soon as it is available

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. 

We will provide another update in 1 hr or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 8:20am PT, June 25th, our engineers started investigating an issue where users may be experiencing delays uploading contacts.

Our engineers are investigating the issue and will provide another update within the next hour. Mail send is not affected.

incidents.name: Billing Changes & Payment Processing Failure

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix implemented and confirmed that issues surrounding account credit card updates, processing payments, and updating account plans has been resolved. All services are now operational at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. All customers should now be able to update billing information, make payments, and update account plans. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:20 pm PST on June 23, our engineers began investigating an issue with changing billing information & processing payments. Customers may not be able to update credit card information, make payments, or make changes to account plans at this time. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Account management degraded

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have implemented a fix and have monitored the results. We can confirm that the issue affecting account management—including retrieving or updating account, subuser, or teammate information via the API or console; creating or managing subusers or teammates; Forgot Password functionality; and new signups—has been resolved.

All services are now operating as expected.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. 

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around pm 10:15 am Pacific Time on Wednesday, June 11th, our engineers began investigating an issue which may be preventing customers from managing their accounts. 

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Customers not able to update their payment methods or upgrade subscriptions

incident_updates.body: At this time all issues with processing payments/ upgrades has been confirmed as resolved.

Starting around 7 AM PST on 6/04/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with processing payments / upgrades. Users may experience difficulties updating their payment methods or upgrading subscriptions. This issue does not impact mail send. 

Our engineers have identified the issue and are actively working towards a resolution. We have identified the affected accounts and are diligently ensuring that all systems are restored to optimal performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes, or sooner if more information becomes available.

incidents.name: IP Access Management UI Failure

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the IP Access Management UI page has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should now be able to access the IP Access Management page in the UI again. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 3:00 pm PDT on 5/20/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue impacting IP Access Management. Some users may experience trouble accessing the IP Access Management page in the UI. This does not impact mail send or the IP Access Management API endpoints. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unified Account Signup & Linking Failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issues with creating a new SendGrid account, linking an existing SendGrid account to Twilio, and changing or cancelling paid plans has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Starting around 12:20 pm PDT on 5/20/2025, our engineers began investigating an issue with some SendGrid account management features. Users may have experienced issues creating a new SendGrid account, linking an existing SendGrid account to Twilio, and changing or cancelling paid plans. This did not impact mail send. 

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermittent Email Service Disruption

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the systems and confirmed that the issue impacting email sending, templates, and related API requests between 9:35 pm and 9:50 pm PT has been fully resolved. All services are now operating normally.

Our API validation system experienced some unexpected issues between 9:35 pm and 9:50 pm PT. A subset of accounts experienced issues related to sending email, email templates, and associated API requests. This included delays and potential failures when attempting to send mail or access related endpoints. All impacted systems have recovered, and email services are now operating normally.
